Getting an email every time I log in to Zulip is pretty annoying :/

Reading the attitude of the developers in this regard does not give me much hope that the situation will improve in the near future:

Like any good security citizens, we send notification emails to tell a user that there's been a new login to their account.

No idea where they are getting that from, but in my book, showing meaningless "Account Security" messages on every login does not help security. It helps to train people to ignore security messages.
@RalfJ i guess you can turn it off in preferences
every login is annoying though. I wish they change it to alert you only on a new system
@DPC if you find the option to turn it off in the settings, please let me know
I found an open feature request in their github to make this configurable per-user
(I assume it already is configurable by the instance admin?)
I rarely am on machines where I log out, I normally log in once on each machine and then that's it, so I don't get repeat emails. I can see how that might be a tad annoying.
@RalfJ yeah i just checked there is no such setting.
yeah same here david. my browser reloads previous session so I'm never logged out
@davidtwco I assume you also keep cookies over browser restarts? I don't, so most sites think that this is a "new computer" every time I log in.
I think restricting cookie lifetime like that is a much bigger security (and privacy) win than notifications on every login (which are false positives 99% of the time anyway)
@RalfJ yeah, that makes sense. I prefer the convenience of keeping the cookies but there's definitely a trade-off there.
@davidtwco I have a whitelist for a select few sites where I keep cookies, so I get most of the convenience. I guess I could add zulip to that whitelist... I suppose that should help.
That seems like a reasonable solution until the Zulip people make the emails configurable.
For discord whitelisting somehow doesnt help, but maybe it helps here
